data.title: Terminal lineHeight evaluated as EMs relative to terminal font-size
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10 64-Bit

This was working 1.3. I just updated and happen to notice very large spacing between my terminal lines. Setting "editor.lineheight" still evaluates the line height property as points and not EMs.

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Set "terminal.integrated.lineHeight": 20 ( I also have terminal font size set to 12).
2.  Open terminal panel and execute some commands. 

You should see large spacing between terminal output lines in the panel.

data.title: [debt] Cleanup process.env user inheritance and propagation over to renderer processes
Unable to edit first file while comparing files.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.4.0 (1.4.0)
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan (10.11.4)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select two files to compare.
2. Unable to edit the file in the left pane.

I think the first file should be read-only only in case of git diff, not while doing manual comparison of 2 files.

data.title: "Debug: Add to Watch" option has disappeared after the upgrade to version 1.4.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run any node.js app in the debug mode and stop on any break point
2. Select any variable and open right click menu for it
3. In the version prior 1.4.0 there was "Debug: Add to Watch" option which is now missing

It was very helpful to have that option, please return it back.

data.title: sidebar action and git window shortcut
data.body:
1. We should have the ability to hide sidebar.
2. And change shortcut to **`command-shift-G`** like the other four commands(explorer, search, debug and ext) play.

data.title: Minimap required
data.body:
In sublime or atom. We can use minimap plugin to show where you are in current file.
But in vscode, there is no such plugin or internal to do such work.

Would you like add one？😀

data.title: Hiding derived files does not work for *.js.map
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 Enterprise x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Setup a TypeScript project with sourceMap: true and no outputDir.
2. Run TypeScript compilation
3. Configure [Hiding derived JavaScript files](http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/typescript#_hiding-derived-javascript-files) following the documentation
4. Add another line `"**/*.js.map": { "when": "$(basename).ts"`} to also hide the derived mapping files

Expected Behavior:

The derived mapping files, ending in *.js.map, no longer show up in the explorer

Actual Behavior:

The derived mapping files, ending in *.js.map, still show up in the explorer

data.title: command + <number> key behaviers
data.body:
We can use **`command+\`** and **`command+<number>key`** to split editor.
Why not use **`command+<number>key`** to switch tabbar file list.

Just we have three file `a`,`b`,`c`opened. So use **`command+1`** open `a`,**`command+2`** open `b`,**`command+3`** open `c`.

data.title: files.associations intellisense does not work within quotation marks
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Fedora 24

Steps to Reproduce:
1. add to user settings.json a file assocations stub:

``` json
"files.associations": {
        "*.xml": ""
 }
```
1. Click the cursor between the empty quotation marks and press Ctrl+Spacebar, as indicated should work in the image at https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/overview#_adding-a-file-extension-to-a-language
2. Get "No suggestions" ![screenshot from 2016-08-05 13-07-25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/201996/17435160/220afaa4-5b0f-11e6-9b04-dd456fb4fb72.png)
3. Delete the quotation marks and try Ctrl+Spacebar again to get list of language suggestions.
   ![screenshot from 2016-08-05 13-07-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/201996/17435173/472d8c48-5b0f-11e6-8b47-0d932e68ceaa.png)

data.title: Adopt Marketplace CDN changes
data.body:
- [x] Support redirection in Marketplace requests
- [x] Support `gzip` encoding in Marketplace requests
- [x] Include the default icon in the product
- [x] Add `"assetTypes":["Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default"]` and flag `0x02` to be able to figure out whether an extension has an icon
- [x] Only request for the latest extension version during a query
- [x] Don't interpolate asset URLs, request them all
- [x] Send `redirect=true` when fetching the extension VSIX. In case of error, fallback to a request without that parameter.
- [x] Implement CDN fallback logic, with telemetry
- [x] Add telemetry for asset download time

data.title: Show the release notes in the product instead of providing link
data.body:
In order to get this to work we need to:
- [x] Cleanup the [`release-notes`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/tree/master/release-notes) folder and standardise the release notes markdown files names. Each file should be in a well defined format (e.g. `v1.4.md` would be a good format, since we only do release notes for `minor` releases, not `patches`) such that Code can locate them. @gregvanl 
- [x] Fix whatever breakage that renaming cause, namely the [website](https://code.visualstudio.com/Updates), which already expects certain file names. @gregvanl 
- [x] Implement the rendering of the markdown inside Code itself. @joaomoreno

data.title: Code fails to launch (non-elevated) if there is already an existing (elevated) process
data.body:
There's a similar case #3180 that was closed as a dupe of #929, however I can reproduce this much worse than #929.
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run VS Code as Admin
2. Try to launch code as non-Admin (from taskbar, shell, explorer context menu)

Nothing happens. No new Code window, and nothing opens in the Admin instance either.

data.title: Terminal path uses incorrect drive letter casing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.10586] 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Terminal (or use the Open in command prompt in explorer - has same issue)
2. Drive letter casing is wrong in the path.

My drive letter in windows is uppercase `C`, but cmd displays in this case a lowercase `c`.

Actual result: `c:\Users\msc\Programming>`
Expected result: `C:\Users\msc\Programming>`

This is inconvenient as I often run node tools from the terminal, and not all node tools are case insensitive.

data.title: Question: Is there a preferred way for an extension to store data/state across sessions?
data.body:
My extension searches for the Dart SDK at startup (it scans the PATH environment variable). I could make this faster if I cached the last place I found it and always inserted that at the top of the list at startup (PATHs can be long, especially on Windows!).

Is there a good way for me to do this? Stashing it in a text file is good enough for me (assuming there's no relevant API), but I want to make sure I put it in a good place across all platforms.

Asking the user to provide add the SDK path to config is not a good experience; they have the ability to override it but it will be a really bad first-launch experience to ask the user to provide this (especially if they installed it with `apt-get` and might have no idea where it is).

data.title: Suggestion: Add the ability to autocomplete files that exist in explorer
data.body: At times you need to write the name of the resource that appears in explorer like when you're doing web development and you need to reference whatever file, so this can be pretty nice feature to have.

data.title: Autoupdate not working on Mac with Visual Studio Code.app in applications subfolder
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.3 - > 1.4
- OS Version:
  Mac OS X 10.10.5
  Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VSCode version 1.3 in Applications\DevelopmentTools folder on Mac OS X
2. Say yes with restart when VSCode reports an upgrade
3. When VSCode restarts it will remain version 1.3

P.S. That also happened with earlier versions of VSCode. While the application can not be upgradedf - Upgrading extensions works just fine.

Workaround:
Download new installer manually and overwrite old application manually.

data.title: toggleTerminal key binding not working with focus in terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 (10.0.10586)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. add new keybinding: `{ "key": "f1", "command": "workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal"},`
2. close integrated terminal if open
3. press F1, terminal expands on bottom, with keyboard cursor inside
4. press F1, terminal will stay, and `A` will be added to terminal

Expected behavior: 4. press F1, terminal collapses
